problem: I have two 20-sided dice that each have 4 maroon sides, 7 teal sides, 8 cyan sides, and one sparkly side. If I roll both dice, what is the probability they come up the same?
solution: This problem requires a little bit of casework.  There are four ways in which the dice can both show the same thing: if they both show maroon, both show teal, both show cyan or both show sparkly. The probability of getting maroon is $\dfrac{4}{20}$, so the probability that they will both show maroon is $\left(\dfrac{4}{20}\right)^2=\dfrac{16}{400}$. Similarly, the probability of getting teal is $\dfrac{7}{20}$, so the probability that they will both show teal is $\left(\dfrac{7}{20}\right)^2=\dfrac{49}{400}$, the probability of getting cyan is $\dfrac{8}{20}$, so the probability that they will both show cyan is $\left(\dfrac{8}{20}\right)^2=\dfrac{64}{400}$ and the probability of getting sparkly is $\dfrac{1}{20}$, so the probability that they will both get sparkly is $\left(\dfrac{1}{20}\right)^2=\dfrac{1}{400}$. So our answer is $\dfrac{16}{400}+\dfrac{49}{400}+\dfrac{64}{400}+\dfrac{1}{400}=\frac{130}{400}=\boxed{\dfrac{13}{40}}$.
model_solution:
Step 1:  The problem requires finding the probability that two 20-sided dice come up the same when rolled. To begin, we need to determine the total number of possible outcomes when rolling two 20-sided dice. This can be calculated by multiplying the number of sides on the first die by the number of sides on the second die, which gives us 20 × 20 = 400 possible outcomes.

2. Next, we need to find the number of favorable outcomes, which in this case are the outcomes where both dice show the same color.
Step 3: 
The probability that both dice come up maroon is $\left( \frac{4}{20} \right) ^{2}=\frac{16}{400}.$
The probability that both dice come up teal is $\left( \frac{7}{20} \right) ^{2}=\frac{49}{400}.$
The probability that both dice come up cyan is $\left( \frac{8}{20} \right) ^{2}=\frac{64}{400}.$
The probability that both dice come up sparkly is $\left( \frac{1}{20} \right) ^{2}=\frac{1}{400}.$
Step 4: 
The probability that both dice show the same color is $\frac{16}{400} + \frac{49}{400} + \frac{64}{400} + \frac{1}{400} = \frac{130}{400}.$
Step 5: 
The probability that the dice show different colors is 1 -  $\frac{130}{400} = \frac{270}{400}.$
Step 6:
The probability that the dice come up the same is $\frac{130}{400}$
Step 7:
The probability that the dice come up the same is $\frac{130}{400} = \frac{13}{40}.$
The probability that both dice come up the same is $\frac{130}{400} = \frac{13}{40}.$
Step 8:
The probability that the dice come up the same is $\frac{13}{40}.$
The probability that both dice come up the same is $\frac{13}{40}.$
The probability that the dice come up the same is $\frac{13}{40}.$
